str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From para and phero; to bear along or aside, i.e. Carry off; by implication, to avert.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
Apparently a primary word; foreign; by implication, a guest or entertainer.
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To confirm, ratify, secure, establish; pass: I guarantee. From bebaios; to stabilitate.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Neuter Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To help, benefit, do good, be useful (to), profit. From the same as opheleia; to be useful, i.e. To benefit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
